meanings.definition: Relating to a council or assembly.
meanings.sent1: The conciliar decision was made by the group of leaders.
meanings.sent2: The conciliar meeting brought together representatives from different regions.
meanings.sent3: The conciliar gathering had everyone talking at once!
meanings.sent4: The conciliar atmosphere in the room was buzzing with ideas.
meanings.sent5: The conciliar discussions were filled with diverse opinions.

meanings.sent1: Their conciliar views on the matter led to a quick resolution.
meanings.sent2: The team worked conciliarly to achieve their goal.
meanings.sent3: The conciliar twins always finished each other's sentences.
meanings.sent4: The music and lyrics were conciliar, creating a beautiful song.
meanings.sent5: The colors of the painting were conciliar, blending seamlessly together.
